intro: Scleromitrion angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family, characterized by its woody stems and showy, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in well-drained, sunny environments. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, adapted to reduce water loss in arid conditions. The flowers, which are usually pink or red, bloom in spring and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
